entry.title: Awesome Go Updates on Apr 05, 2022
entry.content:
Bit-packing and Compression

  • crunch (⭐100) - Go package implementing buffers for handling various datatypes easily.
  • go-ef (⭐39) - A Go implementation of the Elias-Fano encoding.
  • roaring (⭐2.7k) - Go package implementing compressed bitsets.

Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

  • cuckoofilter (⭐1.2k) - Cuckoo filter: a good alternative to a counting bloom filter implemented in Go.
  • ring (⭐141) - Go implementation of a high performance, thread safe bloom filter.

Data Structure and Algorithm Collections

  • algorithms (⭐821) - Algorithms and data structures.CLRS study.
  • go-datastructures (⭐7.8k) - Collection of useful, performant, and thread-safe data structures.
  • gods (⭐17k) - Go Data Structures. Containers, Sets, Lists, Stacks, Maps, BidiMaps, Trees, HashSet etc.
  • gostl (⭐1.1k) - Data structure and algorithm library for go, designed to provide functions similar to C++ STL.

Iterators

  • goterator (⭐17) - Iterator implementation to provide map and reduce functionalities.
  • iter (⭐191) - Go implementation of C++ STL iterators and algorithms.

Maps

  • dict (⭐47) - Python-like dictionaries (dict) for Go.

Nullable Types

  • nan (⭐87) - Zero allocation Nullable structures in one library with handy conversion functions, marshallers and unmarshallers.
  • null (⭐38) - Nullable Go types that can be marshalled/unmarshalled to/from JSON.
  • typ (⭐46) - Null Types, Safe primitive type conversion and fetching value from complex structures.

Queues

  • deque (⭐200) - A highly optimized double-ended queue.
  • deque (⭐690) - Fast ring-buffer deque (double-ended queue).
  • goconcurrentqueue (⭐427) - Concurrent FIFO queue.
  • memlog (⭐133) - An easy to use, lightweight, thread-safe and append-only in-memory data structure inspired by Apache Kafka.

Sets

  • dsu (⭐15) - Disjoint Set data structure implementation in Go.
  • golang-set (⭐4.5k) - Thread-Safe and Non-Thread-Safe high-performance sets for Go.
  • goset (⭐52) - A useful Set collection implementation for Go.
  • set (⭐29) - Simple set data structure implementation in Go using LinkedHashMap.

Text Analysis

  • bleve (⭐10k) - Modern text indexing library for go.
  • go-adaptive-radix-tree (⭐392) - Go implementation of Adaptive Radix Tree.
  • go-edlib (⭐517) - Go string comparison and edit distance algorithms library (Levenshtein, LCS, Hamming, Damerau levenshtein, Jaro-Winkler, etc.) compatible with Unicode.
  • trie (⭐776) - Trie implementation in Go.

Trees

  • hashsplit (⭐31) - Split byte streams into chunks, and arrange chunks into trees, with boundaries determined by content, not position.
  • merkle (⭐19) - Space-efficient computation of Merkle root hashes and inclusion proofs.

Pipes

  • ordered-concurrently (⭐41) - Go module that processes work concurrently and returns output in a channel in the order of input.
  • parapipe (⭐37) - FIFO Pipeline which parallels execution on each stage while maintaining the order of messages and results.
  • pipeline (⭐58) - An implementation of pipelines with fan-in and fan-out.

Caches

  • 2q (⭐47) - 2Q in-memory cache implementation.
  • couchcache (⭐67) - RESTful caching micro-service backed by Couchbase server.
  • fastcache (⭐2.2k) - fast thread-safe inmemory cache for big number of entries. Minimizes GC overhead.
  • GCache (⭐2.7k) - Cache library with support for expirable Cache, LFU, LRU and ARC.
  • gdcache (⭐13) - A pure non-intrusive cache library implemented by golang, you can use it to implement your own distributed cache.
  • go-mcache (⭐98) - Fast in-memory key:value store/cache library. Pointer caches.
  • groupcache (⭐13k) - Groupcache is a caching and cache-filling library, intended as a replacement for memcached in many cases.
  • timedmap (⭐75) - Map with expiring key-value pairs.
  • ttlcache (⭐1.1k) - An in-memory cache with item expiration and generics.
  • ttlcache (⭐10) - In-memory key value storage with TTL for each record.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • badger (⭐15k) - Fast key-value store in Go.
  • bbolt (⭐8.9k) - An embedded key/value database for Go.
  • Bitcask - Bitcask is an embeddable, persistent and fast key-value (KV) database written in pure Go with predictable read/write performance, low latency and high throughput thanks to the bitcask on-disk layout (LSM+WAL).
  • buntdb (⭐4.7k) - Fast, embeddable, in-memory key/value database for Go with custom indexing and spatial support.
  • clover (⭐760) - A lightweight document-oriented NoSQL database written in pure Golang.
  • pudge (⭐373) - Fast and simple key/value store written using Go's standard library.

Database Tools

  • clickhouse-bulk (⭐498) - Collects small inserts and sends big requests to ClickHouse servers.

Interfaces to Multiple Backends

  • cayley (⭐15k) - Graph database with support for multiple backends.
  • dsc (⭐34) - Datastore connectivity for SQL, NoSQL, structured files.
  • gokv (⭐801) - Simple key-value store abstraction and implementations for Go (Redis, Consul, etcd, bbolt, BadgerDB, LevelDB, Memcached, DynamoDB, S3, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, CockroachDB and many more).

Relational Database Drivers

  • avatica (⭐122) - Apache Avatica/Phoenix SQL driver for database/sql.
  • bgc (⭐21) - Datastore Connectivity for BigQuery for go.
  • firebirdsql (⭐243) - Firebird RDBMS SQL driver for Go.
  • go-adodb (⭐148) - Microsoft ActiveX Object DataBase driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-mssqldb (⭐1.9k) - Microsoft MSSQL driver for Go.
  • go-oci8 (⭐634) - Oracle driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • go-sql-driver/mysql (⭐15k) - MySQL driver for Go.
  • go-sqlite3 (⭐8.6k) - SQLite3 driver for go that uses database/sql.
  • godror (⭐559) - Oracle driver for Go, using the ODPI-C driver.
  • gofreetds (⭐113) - Microsoft MSSQL driver. Go wrapper over FreeTDS.
  • pgx (⭐12k) - PostgreSQL driver supporting features beyond those exposed by database/sql.
  • pig (⭐17) - Simple pgx (⭐12k) wrapper to execute and scan (⭐1.4k) query results easily.
  • pq (⭐9.5k) - Pure Go Postgres driver for database/sql.
  • Sqinn-Go (⭐450) - SQLite with pure Go.
  • sqlhooks (⭐656) - Attach hooks to any database/sql driver.

NoSQL Database Drivers

  • aerospike-client-go (⭐450) - Aerospike client in Go language.
  • arangolite (⭐72) - Lightweight golang driver for ArangoDB.
  • asc (⭐11) - Datastore Connectivity for Aerospike for go.
  • forestdb (⭐36) - Go bindings for ForestDB.
  • go-couchbase (⭐323) - Couchbase client in Go.
  • go-pilosa (⭐57) - Go client library for Pilosa.
  • go-rejson (⭐343) - Golang client for redislabs' ReJSON module using Redigo golang client. Store and manipulate structs as JSON objects in redis with ease.
  • gocb (⭐373) - Official Couchbase Go SDK.
  • gocosmos (⭐22) - REST client and standard database/sql driver for Azure Cosmos DB.
  • gocql - Go language driver for Apache Cassandra.
  • godis (⭐113) - redis client implement by golang, inspired by jedis.
  • godscache (⭐11) - A wrapper for the Google Cloud Platform Go Datastore package that adds caching using memcached.
  • gomemcache (⭐1.8k) - memcache client library for the Go programming language.
  • gorethink (⭐1.7k) - Go language driver for RethinkDB.
  • goriak (⭐30) - Go language driver for Riak KV.
  • neo4j (⭐29) - Neo4j Rest API Bindings for Golang.
  • neoism (⭐390) - Neo4j client for Golang.
  • qmgo (⭐1.3k) - The MongoDB driver for Go. It‘s based on official MongoDB driver but easier to use like Mgo.
  • redeo (⭐445) - Redis-protocol compatible TCP servers/services.
  • redigo (⭐9.8k) - Redigo is a Go client for the Redis database.
  • rueidis (⭐2.7k) - Fast Redis RESP3 client with auto pipelining and server-assisted client side caching.
  • xredis (⭐19) - Typesafe, customizable, clean & easy to use Redis client.

Search and Analytic Databases

  • elastic (⭐7.5k) - Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • elasticsql (⭐1.2k) - Convert sql to elasticsearch dsl in Go.
  • elastigo (⭐942) - Elasticsearch client library.
  • go-elasticsearch (⭐5.9k) - Official Elasticsearch client for Go.
  • goes (⭐31) - Library to interact with Elasticsearch.
  • skizze (⭐92) - probabilistic data-structures service and storage.

entry.content:
Language Detection

  • guesslanguage (⭐58) - Functions to determine the natural language of a unicode text.
  • whatlanggo (⭐659) - Natural language detection package for Go. Supports 84 languages and 24 scripts (writing systems e.g. Latin, Cyrillic, etc).

Morphological Analyzers

  • snowball (⭐38) - Snowball stemmer port (cgo wrapper) for Go. Provides word stem extraction functionality Snowball native.
  • spaGO (⭐1.8k) - Self-contained Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing library in Go.

Slugifiers

  • go-slugify (⭐95) - Make pretty slug with multiple languages support.
  • slug (⭐1.3k) - URL-friendly slugify with multiple languages support.
  • Slugify (⭐34) - Go slugify application that handles string.

Tokenizers

  • gojieba (⭐2.5k) - This is a Go implementation of jieba (⭐34k) which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
  • gotokenizer (⭐21) - A tokenizer based on the dictionary and Bigram language models for Golang. (Now only support chinese segmentation)
  • gse (⭐2.7k) - Go efficient text segmentation; support english, chinese, japanese and other.
  • MMSEGO (⭐62) - This is a GO implementation of MMSEG which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
  • prose (⭐3.1k) - Library for text processing that supports tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity extraction, and more. English only.

Translation

  • go-i18n (⭐3.3k) - Package and an accompanying tool to work with localized text.
  • go-mystem (⭐34) - CGo bindings to Yandex.Mystem - russian morphology analyzer.
  • go-pinyin (⭐1.7k) - CN Hanzi to Hanyu Pinyin converter.
  • gotext (⭐473) - GNU gettext utilities for Go.
  • iuliia-go (⭐53) - Transliterate Cyrillic → Latin in every possible way.
  • t (⭐20) - Another i18n pkg for golang, which follows GNU gettext style and supports .po/.mo files: t.T (gettext), t.N (ngettext), etc. And it contains a cmd tool xtemplate (⭐20), which can extract messages as a pot file from text/html template.

Transliteration

  • enca (⭐18) - Minimal cgo bindings for libenca, which detects character encodings.
  • go-unidecode (⭐141) - ASCII transliterations of Unicode text.
  • gounidecode (⭐80) - Unicode transliterator (also known as unidecode) for Go.

Formatters

  • address (⭐77) - Handles address representation, validation and formatting.
  • align (⭐84) - A general purpose application that aligns text.
  • bytes (⭐553) - Formats and parses numeric byte values (10K, 2M, 3G, etc.).
  • go-fixedwidth (⭐86) - Fixed-width text formatting (encoder/decoder with reflection).
  • go-humanize (⭐4.6k) - Formatters for time, numbers, and memory size to human readable format.
  • gotabulate (⭐337) - Easily pretty-print your tabular data with Go.
  • textwrap (⭐5) - Wraps text at end of lines. Implementation of textwrap module from Python.

Markup Languages

  • bafi (⭐107) - Universal JSON, BSON, YAML, XML translator to ANY format using templates.
  • bbConvert (⭐12) - Converts bbCode to HTML that allows you to add support for custom bbCode tags.
  • blackfriday (⭐5.6k) - Markdown processor in Go.
  • go-output-format (⭐18) - Output go structures into multiple formats (YAML/JSON/etc) in your command line app.
  • go-toml (⭐1.8k) - Go library for the TOML format with query support and handy cli tools.
  • html-to-markdown (⭐2.9k) - Convert HTML to Markdown. Even works with entire websites and can be extended through rules.
  • htmlquery (⭐769) - An XPath query package for HTML, lets you extract data or evaluate from HTML documents by an XPath expression.
  • mxj (⭐627) - Encode / decode XML as JSON or map[string]interface{}; extract values with dot-notation paths and wildcards. Replaces x2j and j2x packages.
  • toml (⭐4.8k) - TOML configuration format (encoder/decoder with reflection).

Parsers/Encoders/Decoders

  • allot (⭐59) - Placeholder and wildcard text parsing for CLI tools and bots.
  • codetree (⭐25) - Parses indented code (python, pixy, scarlet, etc.) and returns a tree structure.
  • commonregex (⭐900) - A collection of common regular expressions for Go.
  • did (⭐93) - DID (Decentralized Identifiers) Parser and Stringer in Go.
  • doi (⭐11) - Document object identifier (doi) parser in Go.
  • editorconfig-core-go (⭐147) - Editorconfig file parser and manipulator for Go.
  • go-nmea (⭐244) - NMEA parser library for the Go language.
  • go-vcard (⭐118) - Parse and format vCard.
  • gofeed (⭐2.7k) - Parse RSS and Atom feeds in Go.
  • gographviz (⭐564) - Parses the Graphviz DOT language.
  • gonameparts (⭐43) - Parses human names into individual name parts.
  • ltsv (⭐9) - High performance LTSV (Labeled Tab Separated Value) reader for Go.
  • normalize (⭐52) - Sanitize, normalize and compare fuzzy text.
  • parseargs-go (⭐10) - string argument parser that understands quotes and backslashes.
  • parth (⭐0) - URL path segmentation parsing.
  • sdp (⭐113) - SDP: Session Description Protocol [RFC 4566].
  • sh (⭐7.8k) - Shell parser and formatter.
  • when (⭐1.4k) - Natural EN and RU language date/time parser with pluggable rules.
  • xj2go (⭐36) - Convert xml or json to go struct.

Regular Expressions

  • genex (⭐76) - Count and expand Regular Expressions into all matching Strings.
  • go-wildcard (⭐87) - Simple and lightweight wildcard pattern matching.
  • goregen (⭐92) - Library for generating random strings from regular expressions.
  • regroup (⭐147) - Match regex expression named groups into go struct using struct tags and automatic parsing.

Sanitation

  • bluemonday (⭐3.4k) - HTML Sanitizer.
  • gofuckyourself (⭐69) - A sanitization-based swear filter for Go.

Scrapers

  • colly (⭐24k) - Fast and Elegant Scraping Framework for Gophers.
  • dataflowkit (⭐688) - Web scraping Framework to turn websites into structured data.
  • GoQuery (⭐15k) - GoQuery brings a syntax and a set of features similar to jQuery to the Go language.

  • Tagify (⭐39) - Produces a set of tags from given source.
  • xurls (⭐1.2k) - Extract urls from text.

RSS

  • podcast (⭐136) - iTunes Compliant and RSS 2.0 Podcast Generator in Golang

Utility/Miscellaneous

  • go-runewidth (⭐643) - Functions to get fixed width of the character or string.

  • kace (⭐20) - Common case conversions covering common initialisms.

  • radix (⭐193) - Fast string sorting algorithm.
  • TySug (⭐19) - Alternative suggestions with respect to keyboard layouts.

  • pagoda (⭐2.6k) - Rapid, easy full-stack web development starter kit built in Go.

Template Engines

  • got (⭐38) - A Go code generator inspired by Hero and Fasttemplate. Has include files, custom tag definitions, injected Go code, language translation, and more.

entry.content:
Standard CLI

  • carapace (⭐736) - Command argument completion generator for spf13/cobra.

Uncategorized

  • openapi (⭐11) - OpenAPI 3.x parser.

entry.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 04, 2022
entry.content:
Audio and Music

  • flac (⭐336) - Native Go FLAC encoder/decoder with support for FLAC streams.
  • gaad (⭐131) - Native Go AAC bitstream parser.
  • GoAudio (⭐377) - Native Go Audio Processing Library.
  • gosamplerate (⭐36) - libsamplerate bindings for go.
  • id3v2 (⭐348) - ID3 decoding and encoding library for Go.
  • malgo (⭐341) - Mini audio library.
  • minimp3 (⭐129) - Lightweight MP3 decoder library.
  • Oto (⭐1.7k) - A low-level library to play sound on multiple platforms.
  • PortAudio (⭐778) - Go bindings for the PortAudio audio I/O library.

Authentication and OAuth

  • branca (⭐90) - branca token specification implementation (⭐230) for Golang 1.15+.
  • gologin (⭐1.9k) - chainable handlers for login with OAuth1 and OAuth2 authentication providers.
  • gorbac (⭐1.6k) - provides a lightweight role-based access control (RBAC) implementation in Golang.
  • goth (⭐6.1k) - provides a simple, clean, and idiomatic way to use OAuth and OAuth2. Handles multiple providers out of the box.
  • jwt (⭐363) - Lightweight JSON Web Token (JWT) library.
  • jwt-auth (⭐234) - JWT middleware for Golang http servers with many configuration options.
  • osin (⭐1.9k) - Golang OAuth2 server library.
  • otpgen (⭐140) - Library to generate TOTP/HOTP codes.
  • otpgo (⭐75) - Time-Based One-Time Password (TOTP) and HMAC-Based One-Time Password (HOTP) library for Go.
  • paseto (⭐900) - Golang implementation of Platform-Agnostic Security Tokens (PASETO).
  • scope (⭐41) - Easily Manage OAuth2 Scopes In Go.
  • scs (⭐2.4k) - Session Manager for HTTP servers.
  • securecookie (⭐81) - Efficient secure cookie encoding/decoding.
  • session (⭐118) - Go session management for web servers (including support for Google App Engine - GAE).
  • sessions (⭐78) - Dead simple, highly performant, highly customizable sessions service for go http servers.
  • sessionup (⭐128) - Simple, yet effective HTTP session management and identification package.
  • sjwt (⭐123) - Simple jwt generator and parser.

Blockchain

  • cosmos-sdk (⭐6.6k) - A Framework for Building Public Blockchains in the Cosmos Ecosystem.
  • go-ethereum (⭐49k) - Official Go implementation of the Ethereum protocol.
  • gossamer (⭐451) - A Go implementation of the Polkadot Host.
  • solana-go (⭐1.3k) - Go library to interface with Solana JSON RPC and WebSocket interfaces.
  • tendermint (⭐5.8k) - High-performance middleware for transforming a state machine written in any programming language into a Byzantine Fault Tolerant replicated state machine using the Tendermint consensus and blockchain protocols.

Bot Building

  • echotron (⭐405) - An elegant and concurrent library for Telegram Bots in Go.
  • go-joe - A general-purpose bot library inspired by Hubot but written in Go.
  • go-twitch-irc (⭐377) - Library to write bots for twitch.tv chat
  • micha (⭐30) - Go Library for Telegram bot api.
  • slack-bot (⭐198) - Ready to use Slack Bot for lazy developers: Custom commands, Jenkins, Jira, Bitbucket, Github...
  • telego (⭐734) - Telegram Bot API library for Golang with full one-to-one API implementation.

Build Automation

  • 1build (⭐233) - Command line tool to frictionlessly manage project-specific commands.
  • anko (⭐41) - Simple application watcher for multiple programming languages.
  • gilbert - Build system and task runner for Go projects.
  • goyek (⭐629) - Create build pipelines in Go.
  • mage (⭐4.4k) - Mage is a make/rake-like build tool using Go.
  • mmake (⭐1.7k) - Modern Make.
  • Task (⭐13k) - simple "Make" alternative.
  • taskctl (⭐312) - Concurrent task runner.

Advanced Console UIs

  • asciigraph (⭐2.8k) - Go package to make lightweight ASCII line graph ╭┈╯ in command line apps with no other dependencies.
  • box-cli-maker (⭐565) - Make Highly Customized Boxes for your CLI.
  • cfmt (⭐106) - Contextual fmt inspired by bootstrap color classes.
  • cfmt (⭐70) - Simple and convenient formatted stylized output fully compatible with fmt library.
  • chalk (⭐465) - Intuitive package for prettifying terminal/console output.
  • ctc (⭐50) - The non-invasive cross-platform terminal color library does not need to modify the Print method.
  • go-ataman (⭐19) - Go library for rendering ANSI colored text templates in terminals.
  • go-colorable (⭐793) - Colorable writer for windows.
  • go-colortext (⭐216) - Go library for color output in terminals.
  • go-isatty (⭐864) - isatty for golang.
  • go-prompt (⭐5.4k) - Library for building a powerful interactive prompt, inspired by python-prompt-toolkit (⭐9.8k).
  • gocui (⭐10k) - Minimalist Go library aimed at creating Console User Interfaces.
  • gommon/color (⭐553) - Style terminal text.
  • gookit/color (⭐1.5k) - Terminal color rendering tool library, support 16 colors, 256 colors, RGB color rendering output, compatible with Windows.
  • marker (⭐51) - Easiest way to match and mark strings for colorful terminal outputs.
  • mpb (⭐2.4k) - Multi progress bar for terminal applications.
  • progressbar (⭐4.4k) - Basic thread-safe progress bar that works in every OS.
  • pterm (⭐5.1k) - A library to beautify console output on every platform with many combinable components.
  • spinner (⭐2.4k) - Go package to easily provide a terminal spinner with options.
  • tabby (⭐358) - A tiny library for super simple Golang tables.
  • termbox-go (⭐4.7k) - Termbox is a library for creating cross-platform text-based interfaces.
  • termdash (⭐2.8k) - Go terminal dashboard based on termbox-go and inspired by termui (⭐13k).
  • termenv (⭐1.9k) - Advanced ANSI style & color support for your terminal applications.
  • termui (⭐13k) - Go terminal dashboard based on termbox-go and inspired by blessed-contrib (⭐16k).
  • uiprogress (⭐2.1k) - Flexible library to render progress bars in terminal applications.
  • uitable (⭐741) - Library to improve readability in terminal apps using tabular data.
  • yacspin (⭐449) - Yet Another CLi Spinner package, for working with terminal spinners.

Standard CLI

  • argparse (⭐623) - Command line argument parser inspired by Python's argparse module.
  • argv (⭐41) - Go library to split command line string as arguments array using the bash syntax.
  • climax (⭐219) - Alternative CLI with "human face", in spirit of Go command.
  • clîr (⭐193) - A Simple and Clear CLI library. Dependency free.
  • cmd (⭐43) - Extends the standard flag package to support sub commands and more in idiomatic way.
  • cmdr (⭐140) - A POSIX/GNU style, getopt-like command-line UI Go library.
  • cobra (⭐41k) - Commander for modern Go CLI interactions.
  • commandeer (⭐176) - Dev-friendly CLI apps: sets up flags, defaults, and usage based on struct fields and tags.
  • complete (⭐939) - Write bash completions in Go + Go command bash completion.
  • Dnote (⭐2.9k) - A simple command line notebook with multi-device sync.
  • elvish (⭐6.1k) - An expressive programming language and a versatile interactive shell.
  • env (⭐121) - Tag-based environment configuration for structs.
  • flaggy (⭐862) - A robust and idiomatic flags package with excellent subcommand support.
  • flagvar (⭐45) - A collection of flag argument types for Go's standard flag package.
  • go-arg (⭐2.2k) - Struct-based argument parsing in Go.
  • go-flags (⭐2.7k) - go command line option parser.
  • gocmd (⭐66) - Go library for building command line applications.
  • hiboot cli (⭐181) - cli application framework with auto configuration and dependency injection.
  • job (⭐148) - JOB, make your short-term command as a long-term job.
  • kingpin (⭐3.5k) - Command line and flag parser supporting sub commands (superseded by kong; see below).
  • liner (⭐1.1k) - Go readline-like library for command-line interfaces.
  • mow.cli (⭐886) - Go library for building CLI applications with sophisticated flag and argument parsing and validation.
  • ops (⭐1.4k) - Unikernel Builder/Orchestrator.
  • pflag (⭐2.6k) - Drop-in replacement for Go's flag package, implementing POSIX/GNU-style --flags.
  • sand (⭐27) - Simple API for creating interpreters and so much more.
  • strumt (⭐62) - Library to create prompt chain.
  • subcmd (⭐8) - Another approach to parsing and running subcommands. Works alongside the standard flag package.
  • ts (⭐21) - Timestamp convert & compare tool.
  • ukautz/clif (⭐129) - Small command line interface framework.
  • urfave/cli (⭐23k) - Simple, fast, and fun package for building command line apps in Go (formerly codegangsta/cli).
  • wlog (⭐67) - Simple logging interface that supports cross-platform color and concurrency.

Configuration

  • aconfig (⭐594) - Simple, useful and opinionated config loader.
  • cleanenv (⭐1.9k) - Minimalistic configuration reader (from files, ENV, and wherever you want).
  • config (⭐337) - Cloud native application configuration. Bind ENV to structs in only two lines.
  • configuration (⭐108) - Library for initializing configuration structs from env variables, files, flags and 'default' tag.
  • configure (⭐55) - Provides configuration through multiple sources, including JSON, flags and environment variables.
  • configuro (⭐94) - opinionated configuration loading & validation framework from ENV and Files focused towards 12-Factor compliant applications.
  • confita (⭐505) - Load configuration in cascade from multiple backends into a struct.
  • conflate (⭐36) - Library/tool to merge multiple JSON/YAML/TOML files from arbitrary URLs, validation against a JSON schema, and application of default values defined in the schema.
  • env (⭐5.6k) - Parse environment variables to Go structs (with defaults).
  • env (⭐70) - A lightweight package for loading environment variables into structs.
  • envconfig (⭐244) - Read your configuration from environment variables.
  • envh (⭐100) - Helpers to manage environment variables.
  • fig (⭐381) - Tiny library for reading configuration from a file and from environment variables (with validation & defaults).
  • genv (⭐42) - Read environment variables easily with dotenv support.
  • go-aws-ssm (⭐62) - Go package that fetches parameters from AWS System Manager - Parameter Store.
  • go-conf (⭐11) - Simple library for application configuration based on annotated structs. It supports reading the configuration from environment variables, config files and command line parameters.
  • go-ini (⭐15) - A Go package that marshals and unmarshals INI-files.
  • go-ssm-config (⭐22) - Go utility for loading configuration parameters from AWS SSM (Parameter Store).
  • go-up (⭐43) - A simple configuration library with recursive placeholders resolution and no magic.
  • godotenv (⭐9.5k) - Go port of Ruby's dotenv library (Loads environment variables from .env).
  • gofigure (⭐68) - Go application configuration made easy.
  • gonfig (⭐9) - Tag-based configuration parser which loads values from different providers into typesafe struct.
  • gookit/config (⭐558) - application config manage(load,get,set). support JSON, YAML, TOML, INI, HCL. multi file load, data override merge.
  • hjson (⭐336) - Human JSON, a configuration file format for humans. Relaxed syntax, fewer mistakes, more comments.
  • hocon (⭐85) - Configuration library for working with the HOCON(a human-friendly JSON superset) format, supports features like environment variables, referencing other values, comments and multiple files.
  • ingo (⭐40) - Flags persisted in an ini-like config file.
  • ini (⭐3.5k) - Go package to read and write INI files.
  • joshbetz/config (⭐215) - Small configuration library for Go that parses environment variables, JSON files, and reloads automatically on SIGHUP.
  • kelseyhightower/envconfig (⭐5.3k) - Go library for managing configuration data from environment variables.
  • koanf (⭐3.3k) - Light weight, extensible library for reading config in Go applications. Built in support for JSON, TOML, YAML, env, command line.
  • konfig (⭐645) - Composable, observable and performant config handling for Go for the distributed processing era.
  • mini (⭐37) - Golang package for parsing ini-style configuration files.
  • nasermirzaei89/env (⭐18) - Simple useful package for read environment variables.
  • onion (⭐118) - Layer based configuration for Go, Supports JSON, TOML, YAML, properties, etcd, env, and encryption using PGP.
  • piper (⭐10) - Viper wrapper with config inheritance and key generation.
  • store (⭐275) - Lightweight configuration manager for Go.
  • swap (⭐8) - Instantiate/configure structs recursively, based on build environment. (YAML, TOML, JSON and env).
  • typenv (⭐12) - Minimalistic, zero dependency, typed environment variables library.
  • uConfig (⭐72) - Lightweight, zero-dependency, and extendable configuration management.
  • viper (⭐29k) - Go configuration with fangs.

Continuous Integration

  • CDS (⭐4.7k) - Enterprise-Grade CI/CD and DevOps Automation Open Source Platform.
  • drone (⭐33k) - Drone is a Continuous Integration platform built on Docker, written in Go.
  • gomason (⭐65) - Test, Build, Sign, and Publish your go binaries from a clean workspace.
  • goveralls (⭐790) - Go integration for Coveralls.io continuous code coverage tracking system.
  • overalls (⭐115) - Multi-Package go project coverprofile for tools like goveralls.
  • roveralls (⭐20) - Recursive coverage testing tool.

CSS Preprocessors

  • go-libsass (⭐212) - Go wrapper to the 100% Sass compatible libsass project.

Bit-packing and Compression

  • bingo (⭐45) - Fast, zero-allocation, lexicographical-order-preserving packing of native types to bytes.
  • binpacker (⭐231) - Binary packer and unpacker helps user build custom binary stream.
  • bit (⭐163) - Golang set data structure with bonus bit-twiddling functions.

Bit Sets

  • bitmap (⭐341) - Dense, zero-allocation, SIMD-enabled bitmap/bitset in Go.

Bloom and Cuckoo Filters

  • bloom (⭐147) - Bloom filters implemented in Go.
  • bloom (⭐87) - Golang Bloom filter implementation.
  • bloomfilter (⭐18) - Yet another Bloomfilter implementation in Go, compatible with Java's Guava library.
  • boomfilters (⭐1.6k) - Probabilistic data structures for processing continuous, unbounded streams.

Maps

  • cmap (⭐96) - a thread-safe concurrent map for go, support using interface{} as key and auto scale up shards.

Miscellaneous Data Structures and Algorithms

  • concurrent-writer (⭐57) - Highly concurrent drop-in replacement for bufio.Writer.
  • count-min-log (⭐67) - Go implementation Count-Min-Log sketch: Approximately counting with approximate counters (Like Count-Min sketch but using less memory).
  • fsm (⭐80) - Finite-State Machine package.
  • go-geoindex (⭐358) - In-memory geo index.
  • go-rquad (⭐137) - Region quadtrees with efficient point location and neighbour finding.
  • gofal (⭐19) - fractional api for Go.
  • gota (⭐3.2k) - Implementation of dataframes, series, and data wrangling methods for Go.
  • hide (⭐70) - ID type with marshalling to/from hash to prevent sending IDs to clients.
  • hyperloglog (⭐985) - HyperLogLog implementation with Sparse, LogLog-Beta bias correction and TailCut space reduction.

Text Analysis

  • levenshtein (⭐88) - Levenshtein distance and similarity metrics with customizable edit costs and Winkler-like bonus for common prefix.
  • levenshtein (⭐421) - Implementation to calculate levenshtein distance in Go.
  • mspm (⭐26) - Multi-String Pattern Matching Algorithm for information retrieval.
  • parsefields (⭐7) - Tools for parse JSON-like logs for collecting unique fields and events.
  • ptrie (⭐43) - An implementation of prefix tree.

Trees

  • skiplist (⭐286) - Very fast Go Skiplist implementation.
  • skiplist (⭐84) - Skiplist implementation in Go.
  • treap - Persistent, fast ordered map using tree heaps.

Caches

  • BigCache (⭐7.9k) - Efficient key/value cache for gigabytes of data.
  • cache (⭐193) - In-memory key:value store with expiration time, 0 dependencies, <100 LoC, 100% coverage.
  • cache2go (⭐2.2k) - In-memory key:value cache which supports automatic invalidation based on timeouts.
  • clusteredBigCache (⭐45) - BigCache with clustering support and individual item expiration.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • cockroach (⭐31k) - Scalable, Geo-Replicated, Transactional Datastore.
  • Coffer (⭐40) - Simple ACID key-value database that supports transactions.
  • column (⭐1.5k) - High-performance, columnar, embeddable in-memory store with bitmap indexing and transactions.
  • CovenantSQL (⭐1.5k) - CovenantSQL is a SQL database on blockchain.
  • Databunker (⭐1.3k) - Personally identifiable information (PII) storage service built to comply with GDPR and CCPA.
  • dgraph (⭐21k) - Scalable, Distributed, Low Latency, High Throughput Graph Database.
  • diskv (⭐1.4k) - Home-grown disk-backed key-value store.
  • eliasdb (⭐1k) - Dependency-free, transactional graph database with REST API, phrase search and SQL-like query language.
  • godis (⭐3.7k) - A Golang implemented high-performance Redis server and cluster.
  • goleveldb (⭐6.3k) - Implementation of the LevelDB (⭐38k) key/value database in Go.
  • hare (⭐97) - A simple database management system that stores each table as a text file of line-delimited JSON.
  • immudb (⭐8.8k) - immudb is a lightweight, high-speed immutable database for systems and applications written in Go.
  • influxdb (⭐30k) - Scalable datastore for metrics, events, and real-time analytics.
  • ledisdb (⭐4.1k) - Ledisdb is a high performance NoSQL like Redis based on LevelDB.
  • levigo (⭐419) - Levigo is a Go wrapper for LevelDB.
  • lotusdb (⭐2.2k) - Fast k/v database compatible with lsm and b+tree.
  • Milvus (⭐36k) - Milvus is a vector database for embedding management, analytics and search.
  • moss (⭐1k) - Moss is a simple LSM key-value storage engine written in 100% Go.
  • piladb (⭐207) - Lightweight RESTful database engine based on stack data structures.
  • pogreb (⭐1.3k) - Embedded key-value store for read-heavy workloads.
  • prometheus (⭐59k) - Monitoring system and time series database.
  • rosedb (⭐4.8k) - An embedded k-v database based on LSM+WAL, supports string, list, hash, set, zset.
  • rqlite (⭐17k) - The lightweight, distributed, relational database built on SQLite.
  • tempdb (⭐19) - Key-value store for temporary items.
  • tidb (⭐39k) - TiDB is a distributed SQL database. Inspired by the design of Google F1.
  • tiedot (⭐2.7k) - Your NoSQL database powered by Golang.
  • Vasto (⭐263) - A distributed high-performance key-value store. On Disk. Eventual consistent. HA. Able to grow or shrink without service interruption.
  • VictoriaMetrics (⭐15k) - fast, resource-effective and scalable open source time series database. May be used as long-term remote storage for Prometheus. Supports PromQL.

Database Schema Migration

  • atlas (⭐7k) - A Database Toolkit. A CLI designed to help companies better work with their data.
  • avro (⭐47) - Discover SQL schemas and convert them to AVRO schemas. Query SQL records into AVRO bytes.
  • darwin (⭐149) - Database schema evolution library for Go.
  • go-fixtures (⭐30) - Django style fixtures for Golang's excellent built-in database/sql library.
  • go-pg-migrate (⭐11) - CLI-friendly package for go-pg migrations management.
  • go-pg-migrations (⭐86) - A Go package to help write migrations with go-pg/pg.
  • goavro (⭐1k) - A Go package that encodes and decodes Avro data.
  • goose (⭐8.7k) - Database migration tool. You can manage your database's evolution by creating incremental SQL or Go scripts.
  • gormigrate (⭐1.1k) - Database schema migration helper for Gorm ORM.
  • migrate (⭐17k) - Database migrations. CLI and Golang library.
  • migrator (⭐178) - Dead simple Go database migration library.
  • migrator (⭐25) - MySQL database migrator designed to run migrations to your features and manage database schema update with intuitive go code.
  • schema (⭐42) - Library to embed schema migrations for database/sql-compatible databases inside your Go binaries.
  • skeema (⭐1.3k) - Pure-SQL schema management system for MySQL, with support for sharding and external online schema change tools.
  • soda (⭐1.5k) - Database migration, creation, ORM, etc... for MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQLite.
  • sql-migrate (⭐3.4k) - Database migration tool. Allows embedding migrations into the application using go-bindata.
  • sqlize (⭐122) - Database migration generator. Allows generate sql migration from model and existing sql by differ them.

Database Tools

  • chproxy (⭐1.4k) - HTTP proxy for ClickHouse database.
  • dbbench (⭐109) - Database benchmarking tool with support for several databases and scripts.
  • go-mysql (⭐4.8k) - Go toolset to handle MySQL protocol and replication.
  • octillery (⭐199) - Go package for sharding databases ( Supports every ORM or raw SQL ).
  • pg_timetable (⭐1.2k) - Advanced scheduling for PostgreSQL.
  • pgweb (⭐8.9k) - Web-based PostgreSQL database browser.
  • prep (⭐35) - Use prepared SQL statements without changing your code.
  • pREST (⭐4.4k) - Simplify and accelerate development, ⚡ instant, realtime, high-performance on any Postgres application, existing or new.
  • rwdb (⭐20) - rwdb provides read replica capability for multiple database servers setup.
  • vitess (⭐20k) - vitess provides servers and tools which facilitate scaling of MySQL databases for large scale web services.

SQL Query Builders

  • bqb (⭐171) - Lightweight and easy to learn query builder.
  • buildsqlx (⭐181) - Go database query builder library for PostgreSQL.
  • dbq (⭐413) - Zero boilerplate database operations for Go.
  • Dotsql (⭐748) - Go library that helps you keep sql files in one place and use them with ease.
  • gendry (⭐1.6k) - Non-invasive SQL builder and powerful data binder.
  • godbal (⭐59) - Database Abstraction Layer (dbal) for go. Support SQL builder and get result easily.
  • goqu (⭐2.5k) - Idiomatic SQL builder and query library.
  • gosql (⭐36) - SQL Query builder with better null values support.
  • igor (⭐126) - Abstraction layer for PostgreSQL that supports advanced functionality and uses gorm-like syntax.
  • jet (⭐3.3k) - Framework for writing type-safe SQL queries in Go, with ability to easily convert database query result into desired arbitrary object structure.
  • ormlite (⭐16) - Lightweight package containing some ORM-like features and helpers for sqlite databases.
  • ozzo-dbx (⭐651) - Powerful data retrieval methods as well as DB-agnostic query building capabilities.
  • qry (⭐35) - Tool that generates constants from files with raw SQL queries.
  • sq (⭐201) - Type-safe SQL builder and struct mapper for Go.
  • sqlf (⭐180) - Fast SQL query builder.
  • sqlingo (⭐428) - A lightweight DSL to build SQL in Go.
  • sqrl (⭐281) - SQL query builder, fork of Squirrel with improved performance.
  • Squalus - Thin layer over the Go SQL package that makes it easier to perform queries.
  • Squirrel (⭐7.5k) - Go library that helps you build SQL queries.
  • xo (⭐3.8k) - Generate idiomatic Go code for databases based on existing schema definitions or custom queries supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server.

Date and Time

  • carbon (⭐784) - Simple Time extension with a lot of util methods, ported from PHP Carbon library.
  • cronrange (⭐17) - Parses Cron-style time range expressions, checks if the given time is within any ranges.
  • date (⭐140) - Augments Time for working with dates, date ranges, time spans, periods, and time-of-day.
  • dateparse (⭐2.1k) - Parse date's without knowing format in advance.
  • durafmt (⭐504) - Time duration formatting library for Go.
  • feiertage (⭐49) - Set of functions to calculate public holidays in Germany, incl. specialization on the states of Germany (Bundesländer). Things like Easter, Pentecost, Thanksgiving...
  • go-persian-calendar (⭐222) - The implementation of the Persian (Solar Hijri) Calendar in Go (golang).
  • go-str2duration (⭐113) - Convert string to duration. Support time.Duration returned string and more.
  • go-sunrise (⭐168) - Calculate the sunrise and sunset times for a given location.
  • go-week (⭐10) - An efficient package to work with ISO8601 week dates.
  • gostradamus (⭐210) - A Go package for working with dates.
  • iso8601 (⭐151) - Efficiently parse ISO8601 date-times without regex.
  • kair (⭐24) - Date and Time - Golang Formatting Library.
  • now (⭐4.5k) - Now is a time toolkit for golang.
  • strftime (⭐13) - C99-compatible strftime formatter.
  • timespan (⭐83) - For interacting with intervals of time, defined as a start time and a duration.
